definitions: A supply of a commodity or an amount of money or resources held back or set aside for future use.
A place set aside for special use, such as a nature reserve.
A lack of openness or a tendency to keep one's thoughts, feelings, and affairs private.
A body of troops not committed to battle but available to do so.
An area of land set aside for indigenous people.
examples: The country has a large oil reserve.
The general kept a reserve of soldiers.
Life on the reserve was challenging.
